snippet: A complex security marketed by Wells Fargo promised up to 30 years of monthly interest, but its early redemption, brought about by the Dodd-Frank law, meant big losses for investors.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes a complex security marketed by Wells Fargo that promised up to 30 years of monthly interest, but its early redemption, brought about by the Dodd-Frank law, has meant big losses for investors; states it is illustrative of what can happen when a security is packaged by a firm that intends to have a contrary interest from its customers for the life of the security.
lead_paragraph: A complex security marketed by Wells Fargo promised up to 30 years of monthly interest, but its early redemption, brought about by the Dodd-Frank law, meant big losses for investors.

headline.print_headline: Buried In Details, A Warning To Investors
headline.seo: A Wells Fargo Security Goes Wrong for Investors
headline.main: Buried in Details, a Warning to Investors
